description: Muntham Court is a circular temple or shrine located in what was an Iron Age settlement. Lewis gives it a chronology of mid 1st CE to early 4th CE, but an earlier pre-roman history seems likely though much of the evidence has been destroyed by later Roman work on the site.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Muntham Court, Findon (West Sussex), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Smith, A., (2008), The Fate of Pagan Temples in Sount-East Britain during the late and post-Roman periods., in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Frere, S., (1958), in Problems of Iron Age in S Britain, pg. 20
Holleyman, Burstow, (1957), Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon, Sussex, Brighton and Hove Archaeological Society
Holleyman, Burstow, (1956), Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon, Sussex Notes and Queries
Holleyman, Burstow, (1955), Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon, Sussex, Brighton and Hove Archaeological Society
